title: Update coverage messaging to Europe + key destinations and increase Contact Us prominence

requirements.text: Update all user-facing coverage/region marketing copy to state KK Euro Express ships across Europe and also to international destinations, explicitly mentioning example destinations: UK, USA, Canada, and Italy (and wording like “and more”). Apply this consistently across pages/components that currently mention “Punjab” coverage (e.g., Home hero headline/paragraph, About page hero and overview copy, About “Our Coverage” intro, CoverageSection, ValueProps, HowItWorks step text, ServicesPreview descriptions, and footer brand blurb).

quotes: across europe ok , but add uk , usa, canada, italy etc

acceptanceCriteria: Home page hero headline/paragraph no longer says “Punjab-Wide Deliveries” or “across Punjab”; it references Europe-wide service and includes examples (UK/USA/Canada/Italy) in natural English.
About page hero paragraph, “Who We Are” paragraphs, and “Our Coverage” intro text reference Europe-wide coverage and include example destinations (UK/USA/Canada/Italy).
CoverageSection titles/descriptions no longer say “Punjab-Wide Network” / “throughout Punjab” and instead describe Europe-wide coverage plus example destinations (UK/USA/Canada/Italy).
ValueProps contains no “Punjab-Wide Coverage” title/description; the replacement reflects Europe-wide + example destinations.
HowItWorks step 2 description no longer says “Punjab-wide network”; it reflects Europe-wide shipping (plus global destinations examples where appropriate).
Footer brand description no longer says “across Punjab”; it aligns with Europe-wide + example destinations messaging.
No page introduces conflicting coverage statements (e.g., some sections saying Punjab while others say Europe).

requirements.text: Increase the prominence of “Contact Us” across the site by adding stronger, more frequent contact CTAs without changing the existing contact details (email/phone/24/7). Implement at least: (1) a prominent Contact CTA in the site header on desktop, and (2) an additional Contact/Quote CTA section on the Services page that links to /contact.
acceptanceCriteria: On desktop widths, the header includes a clearly visible “Contact” / “Contact Us” call-to-action element that links to /contact (in addition to existing nav links).
Services page includes a distinct CTA block encouraging users to contact for a quote/help, with a button linking to /contact.
Existing footer contact information remains unchanged: eurobanga@gmail.com, 79736-73529, Available 24/7.

requirements.text: Ensure the Contact page “Contact Information” panel does not display unrelated placeholder contact values when backend contact details are not yet loaded; it must default to the known business email and phone already used in the footer.

quotes: also you know contact info ok

acceptanceCriteria: ContactDetails defaults for email and phone match the known business contact values (email eurobanga@gmail.com and phone 79736-73529) when query data is unavailable.
No default placeholder phone like “+49 123 456 7890” or placeholder email like “info@kkexpress.com” appears on the Contact page.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI components).
Do not modify immutable hook/bootstrap files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (e.g., frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx).
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor; no additional canisters/services.
Do not change the confirmed business contact details shown in the footer (email eurobanga@gmail.com, phone 79736-73529, Available 24/7).
nonGoals: Changing inquiry submission behavior or adding new backend inquiry fields.
Adding third-party integrations (maps, chat widgets, external CRM, etc.).
